This guide is a simplified overview of all the changes in the [[Tricky Trials]] update ({{BE}} 1.21.0 to ''Bedrock Edition'' 1.21.31), which assumes at least some familiarity with the [[Armored Paws]] drop (''Bedrock Edition'' 1.20.80).

== Mobs ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Mobs}}
|-
| [[Bogged]]
| [[File:Bogged.webp|128px]]
| Spawn in [[trial chambers]], [[swamp]]s, and [[mangrove swamp]]s.
| 
* {{Drop|Item|Bone|0|2}}
* {{Drop|Item|Arrow|0|2}}
* {{Drop|Item|Arrow of Poison|0|1}}
* {{xp|5}}, plus {{xp|1|3}} per natural equipment not drop (when killed by a [[player]] or tamed [[wolf]])
| Spawns from [[trial spawner]]s.
|-
| [[Breeze]]
| [[File:Breeze BE1.webp|128px]]
| Spawn in [[trial chambers]].
| 
* {{Drop|Item|Breeze Rod|1|2}}
* {{xp|10}} (when killed by a [[player]] or tamed [[wolf]])
|
* Only spawns from [[trial spawner]]s.
* Drops [[breeze rod]]s, which can be crafted into [[wind charge]]s or a [[mace]].
|}

=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Mobs}}
|-
| [[Fox]]
| {{animate|Fox.png;Snow_Fox.png|128px}}
| Reduced the health from {{hp|20}} to {{hp|10}} to match ''Java Edition''.
|-
| [[Drowned]]
| [[File:Drowned.png|128px]]
|
* Now spawn individually in rivers instead of in groups of two, like in {{edition|java}}.
* Now spawn in aquifers in dripstone caves, like in {{edition|java}}.
|-
| [[Parrot]]
| {{animate|Red_Parrot.png;Blue Parrot.png;Green Parrot.png;Cyan Parrot.png;Gray Parrot.png|128px}}
| Parrot now correctly imitates the [[Bogged]] when nearby.
|-
| [[Panda]], <br> [[wolf]] and <br> [[polar bear]]
| [[File:Panda_JE1_BE1.png|128px]] <br> {{Animate|Wolf JE2 BE2.png; Ashen Wolf JE1 BE1.png; Black Wolf JE1 BE1.png; Chestnut Wolf JE1 BE1.png; Rusty Wolf JE1 BE1.png; Snowy Wolf JE1 BE1.png; Spotted Wolf JE1 BE1.png; Striped Wolf JE1 BE1.png; Woods Wolf JE1 BE1.png|128px}} <br> [[File:Polar_Bear_JE2_BE2.png|128px]]
| Now panic only from [[cactus]], [[freezing]], [[fire]], and [[lightning]] bolt damage.
|-
| [[Witch]]
| [[File:Witch.png|128px]]
|
* Witches now always drop 4–8 [[redstone]] dust on death.
** This is to improve the viability of farms that utilize [[witch hut]]s to obtain redstone dust.
|}
